text: Oof, trying to start using VS Code now and everything missing from Juno is :cry: . Today's: lost a computation because the remote usage doesn't use tmux by default. It's getting close but it still has an edge. Still hoping to transition by this summer.

elements.text: Oof, trying to start using VS Code now and everything missing from Juno is
. Today's: lost a computation because the remote usage doesn't use tmux by default. It's getting close but it still has an edge. Still hoping to transition by this summer.

text: I also miss the ability to rerun some blocks of computation. VSCode really seems to be written with compile to binary languages in mind.
What do you mean? Inline evaluation mostly should be en par with Juno at this point

elements.text: What do you mean? Inline evaluation mostly should be en par with Juno at this point

text: I wasn't able to set it up or understand how i would trigger it
by pressing Alt-Enter (by default that outputs to the REPL, but you can change the `julia.execution.resultType` setting to `inline`)

elements.text: by pressing Alt-Enter (by default that outputs to the REPL, but you can change the
julia.execution.resultType
setting to
inline

text: Everytime i start up Atom or VSC many of my packagess have to pre compile. Any  idea what could cause that?
you might be using different Julia versions or environments

elements.text: you might be using different Julia versions or environments

text: Juno is kinda sneaky about that because it might end up loading different versions of your packages for its own dependencies

elements.text: Juno is kinda sneaky about that because it might end up loading different versions of your packages for its own dependencies

text: I use environments extensively. Does switching the cause a recompilation of  all used packages?
depends

elements.text: depends

text: if you end up with different versions of a package in the dependency graph then every dep of that will be recompiled

elements.text: if you end up with different versions of a package in the dependency graph then every dep of that will be recompiled

text: Why does it evict different version from cache if they are used by a different environment?
Is there something i can do about it?
IIRC Julia up to 1.5 only ever caches one ji file per package

elements.text: IIRC Julia up to 1.5 only ever caches one ji file per package

text: but I might be wrong about that

elements.text: but I might be wrong about that

text: Yeah alt+enter as a feature is working really well.

elements.text: Yeah alt+enter as a feature is working really well.
